Module Manipulators
Package manipulators

Class ManipulatorWith3DOFGripper

java.lang.Object
kin.execmodels.ManipulatorModel
manipulators.ManipulatorWith3DOFGripper
All Implemented Interfaces:
Manipulator
Direct Known Subclasses:
Crane, RedundantArm, SimpleArm, SimpleArm2, SimpleArmLinear, TripodArm
public abstract class ManipulatorWith3DOFGripper
extends ManipulatorModel
An upper class for all manipulators that have 3 servos to control the gripper pose.

      protected void createGripperServos​(int idXY, int idXZ, int idYZ)
      Create the three servo models to control the gripper.
      Parameters:
      idXY - id for the servo that controls rotation in the x-y-plane
      idXZ - id for the servo that controls rotation in the x-z-plane
      idYZ - id for the servo that controls rotation in the y-z-plane

    • defineInverseKinematics

      public void defineInverseKinematics​(InverseKinematics inverseKinematics)
      Description copied from interface: Manipulator
      Define the inverse kinematics instance in order to perfom respective computations without actually move a servo or motor. This call is required, if the manipulator does not provide such an instance on creation, or if it is disabled by Skill -maninvkin.
      Parameters:
      inverseKinematics - inverse kinematics instance

    • currentWristPosition

      public double[] currentWristPosition()
      Description copied from interface: Manipulator
      Get the current wrist position in local coordinates. The wrist is the nearest component to the gripper.
      Returns:
      array of 3 with x, y, z

    • checkAngIntegrity

      public void checkAngIntegrity​(double gripperAngXY, double gripperAngXZ, double gripperAngYZ)

    • canWristReach

      public boolean canWristReach​(double x, double y, double z, double gripperAngXY, double gripperAngXZ, double gripperAngYZ)
      Description copied from interface: Manipulator
      Check, if the given configuration can be reached.
      Parameters:
      x - local coordinate x (cm)
      y - local coordinate y (cm)
      z - local coordinate z (cm)
      gripperAngXY - angle of the gripper segment in the x-y plane (yaw orientation, applied last); may be NaN, if the gripper angle should not change
      gripperAngXZ - angle of the gripper segment in the x-z plane (gripper angle to horizon, applied second); may be NaN, if the gripper angle should not change
      gripperAngYZ - angle of the gripper segment in the y-z plane (gripper axis-rotation, applied first); may be NaN, if the gripper angle should not change
      Returns:
      true if the wrist can reach this configuration

    • privateMoveWristTo

      protected ManipulatorResult privateMoveWristTo​(double x, double y, double z, double gripperAngXY, double gripperAngXZ, double gripperAngYZ, int speedIndicator, double absoluteSpeed, double relativeSpeed)
      Description copied from class: ManipulatorModel

      Inner manipulator method, to perform direct, non-linear wrist movement. This method must not be called by the application developer, call ManipulatorModel.moveWristTo(double, double, double,double,double,double,int,double,double) instead.

      The movement follows the interpolation of the involved servos and motors from start to target angles or lengths. This means, the result trajectory of the wrist is not linear.

      The movement is initiated, but the command immediately returns, i.e. the movement is performed from now.
      Specified by:
      privateMoveWristTo in class ManipulatorModel
      Parameters:
      x - local coordinate x (cm)
      y - local coordinate y (cm)
      z - local coordinate z (cm)
      gripperAngXY - angle of the gripper segment in the x-y plane (yaw orientation, applied last); may be NaN, if the gripper angle should not change
      gripperAngXZ - angle of the gripper segment in the x-z plane (gripper angle to horizon, applied second); may be NaN, if the gripper angle should not change
      gripperAngYZ - angle of the gripper segment in the y-z plane (gripper axis-rotation, applied first); may be NaN, if the gripper angle should not change
      speedIndicator - speed indicator,
      • 0: all motors with default speed
      • 1: all motors should terminate at the same time, whereas the motor that makes the largest move (i.e. those that moves quickest) should run with a relative speed to the maximum (see parameter relativeSpeed)
      • 2: all motors should terminate at the same time, where as the gripper moves with predefined speed (see parameter absoluteSpeed); limit the given speed by the maximum speed resulting by motor limits. Note: the parameter relativeSpeed is also used here to compute the minimum moving time for the gripper servos.
      absoluteSpeed - if speedIndicator==2 absolute gripper speed in cm/s
      relativeSpeed - if speedIndicator==1 relative speed to the maximum for the motor with longest runtime, also used if speedIndicator==2 to define the speed of the gripper servos
      Returns:
      result of the command

    • inverseKinematics

      public InverseKinematics inverseKinematics()
      Description copied from interface: Manipulator
      Get the inverse kinematics instance in order to perfom respective computations without actually move a servo or motor.
      Returns:
